intro: Picramnia guerrerensis, commonly known as Guerrerense Picramnia, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its woody structure and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Picramnia guerrerensis is often found in dry, scrubland habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphology.
